definition: to be good at/to be adept at
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

sentences.english: The principal must be hard-working, good at learning and enterprising.
sentences.chinese: 校長必須是一個勤奮學習，善於學習，勇於進取的人。

sentences.english: Jonathan's good at wall-papering but he's not so handy with a paintbrush.
sentences.chinese: 喬納森善於糊牆紙，但不善於使用漆刷。

sentences.english: Jonathan's good at wall-papering but he's not so handy with a paintbrush.
sentences.chinese: 喬納森善於糊牆紙，但不善於使用漆刷。

sentences.english: My disposition is more inflexible, not to be pooh-poohed communicates contact with at following a person.
sentences.chinese: 我的性格比較僵硬，不善於跟人溝通打交道。

sentences.english: The 3rd, be good at thinking, baconian solution inscribes train of thought and method.
sentences.chinese: 第三，善於思考，歸納解題思路與方法。

sentences.english: Even her soul, so strong for rhapsody, was not enough.
sentences.chinese: 甚至於她那特別善於狂想的靈魂也不足掛齒。

sentences.english: Among ethnic groups, Bai , Bouyei and Miao people are also adept at embroidery.
sentences.chinese: 在民族，白族，布依族和苗族人還善於刺繡。

sentences.english: A good company listens to what its customers say they want.
sentences.chinese: 一個好的公司，善於傾聽用戶的想法。
健談者通常都是善於說謊的人。

sentences.english: Once again, opportunistic Imperial warlords pounced .
sentences.chinese: 善於投機的帝國軍閥再度崛起。

sentences.english: She's very good at dealing with all kinds of people; she never puts a foot wrong.
sentences.chinese: 她善於與各種各樣的人打交道，從來不出紕漏。

sentences.english: He would certainly have done more justice to simple and elegant prose.
sentences.chinese: 他一定善於朗讀質樸風雅的散文。

sentences.english: Turk action qol at quite remove kato action failure.
sentences.chinese: 特科行動組組善於挺除掉加藤的行動失敗。

sentences.english: Besides, you shall be good at communication so that people understand your thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 術業有專攻並善於合理表達自己想法並溝通。

sentences.english: Won't the relaxed dress code damage the company image?
sentences.chinese: 難道這種善於便服的着裝規定不會損害公司形象嗎？

sentences.english: He was good at slicing the ball across the court.
sentences.chinese: 他很善於把球斜打過場。

definition: be smooth and slick (in establishing social relations)
character acquired through long habit/habits and properties
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
